intro: Anoplon tournefortii, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss in dry conditions. Anoplon tournefortii is often used in landscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
